page.title: 14 PRESTON HALL
page.content: William of Cliffe and Preston owned the land where Preston Hall was built from 1600 to 1722. In 1820 David Burton Fowler bought the land and built the house. The conservatory and stone porch were added by Sir William Ropner. The hall is now used as a museum and is owned by Stockton Borough Council. The land around it is used as a park. Walker Street, which is just behind the hall, is a replica of a Victorian street. In the street there are some working craftsmen.There is a farrier, a blacksmith and some workers in wood. There are lots of industrial machines. In the hall there are some period rooms showing life in the nineteenth century. Upstairs there is a collection of children's toys. 'The Dice Players' by De La Tour is a famous painting belonging to the hall.
